paper.name: LLMs Cannot Self-Correct
paper.prompt:
Create a flowchart diagram showing the limitations of self-correction in LLMs.

Include these key elements:
- Initial incorrect response generation
- Self-evaluation attempt: Model tries to detect its own error
- Feedback loop: Model attempts to correct itself
- Failure modes: Show why self-correction often fails (reinforcement of errors, lack of external ground truth)
- Final output: Often still incorrect or worse

Use a red/orange color scheme to highlight limitations. Show the cycle of attempted correction and potential failure points.

diagrams.code:
direction right
// Flow chart: Limitations of Self-Correction in LLMs
title Limitations of Self-Correction in LLMs

// Nodes and groups
Initial incorrect response [shape: oval, color: orange]
Self evaluation attempt [shape: diamond, color: orange]
Attempted correction [shape: rectangle, color: red]
Failure modes [color: orange] {
  Reinforcement of errors [shape: rectangle, color: red]
  Lack of external ground truth [shape: rectangle, color: red]
}
Final output [shape: oval, color: red]

// Relationships
Initial incorrect response > Self evaluation attempt [color: orange]
Self evaluation attempt > Attempted correction: Error detected [color: orange]
Self evaluation attempt > Final output: No error detected [color: orange]
Attempted correction > Failure modes: Correction fails [color: red]
Attempted correction > Final output: Correction applied [color: orange]
Failure modes > Final output [color: red]
Self evaluation attempt < Attempted correction: Re-evaluate
